channel.title: What do you think about vegetarianism?
channel.description:
I just want to know who is a vegan, why the are/aren't, etc. But [i]please[/i] do not let this turn into a flame war.
Me: I am NOT a vegetarian. In fact, vegans tend to annoy me severely. Some kid was walking around my school trying to get everyone to become vegans. He is lucky I'm nice, or I would have beaten the living crap out of him. Of course, I bet someone else already did. Heres the five main types of vegans:
Nazi Vegans: These idiots try to change everyones mind and make all meat eaters go vegan. Then they get mad when they wont. I personally HATE these ones, and feel like slamming them against a wall.
Psuedo (fake) vegans: These just annoy me. They are the ones who say "Oh I don't eat meat, but I eat chicken (or fish)." I have nothing to say to these ones. Some of them even get mad at peope who eat beef, etc.
Standard Vegans: I have no problem with these ones. They are vegans, but keep to themselves, and don't get mad at meat eaters. If a meat eaters question them about it, they also put up a good debate, which I also respect.
Obsessive vegans: The ones who are afraid to step on bugs, or afraid to look at an animal funny in the fear of "scaring" it. They are fun to make fun of.
Hide in a corner Vegans: The ones who are vegan, leave people alone and let them eat meat, but if someone questions them about it, they don't put up a good debate or support their oppinion. These ones are usually just trying to be the "hero".
Summary: I am fine with vegans, but I can't stand the ones who are obsessive, bossy, or cannot support their opinion. I think animals are meant to be eaten, period. I know that sounds harsh, but I include humans in that too. If we get lost in the woods or general wilderness, we will get eaten. If I lived in the woods and a dear is on my lawn, I would pull out a gun and next thing you know I have dinner, a very good one at that. If you ask me, thats fair. They can kill us, so I WILL kill them. Of course, I wouldn't hunt for sport, I would eat what I kill.

Anyway, I don’t really have a problem with them, just a matter of opinion. I personally am an avid hunter with my dad (I’ve personally shot and killed 2 deer, 1 elk, 2 javelinas and 1 mountain lion.[/quote]

item.title: What do you think about vegetarianism?
item.dc:creator: @sdouble sdouble
item.description:
@sdouble wrote:

We are designed to be meat eaters. Look at our teeth. Our eyes are in the fronts of our heads, not on the sides. We are predators. If we weren’t meant to eat meat, we wouldn’t have the teeth we have. We would also have more of a problem digesting it.

But we were also given the ability to think and to show compassion rather than act purely off of instinct (Although in reality, it is instinct that makes us think about things before acting. And no scientist or study can tell us for sure what animals think/know so I’m just assuming animals are dumb beasts with no thought process as the anti-vegetarian people/scientists assume.) With that, you can decide on your own if you were to eat meat or not.

Read full topic

item.source: What do you think about vegetarianism?

item.title: What do you think about vegetarianism?
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

Zach1188:

Faile, I didn’t say a deer would come onto my lawn and kill me and eat me. But if it came on my lawn I would kill and eat it. Heck, I would even come on its “lawn” and kill and eat it. But I was talking about other animals eating me. Like mountian lions and so on. Every animal or plant is meant to be eaten by another animal or plant, thus the circle of life. I think vegetarians/vegans are just defying nature, and indirectly breaking the circle of life.

Ah-men to that!

Some people don’t eat meat because they think hurting animals is wrong, and I just cannot stand that. How did we evlove? There is no way that any of us would be here today if it wasn;t for our ansestors being able to hunt + eat meat. There just would not have been enough food.

People do not realize that killing animals for food, onyl gets rid of the acces population, which will die off anyway.

Imagine it as a bucket. Each spring the tab goes on, and water (animals) are poured into the bucket (Nature.) There are some leaks in the bucket, hence some of the water seeps out (Animals dying from disease, etc…) But the bucket (ecosystem) can only hold so much water, and every year the overflow has to go somewhere. So, instead of causing all the animals starvation, due to lack of food in an enviroment, if we kill off the acces population it does not effect the population of the animal.

Anyway, that is just for hunting, and trapping…

With Cows+Chickens, etc… that we bread just to eat, as long as it isn’t effecting the Enviroment, why is it such a problem??

Read full topic
item.source: What do you think about vegetarianism?

item.title: What do you think about vegetarianism?
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

I think you guys got me all wrong, I do not dislike vegetarians/vegans, I just hate the psuedo ones and the ones who try to push me into converting. If they keep to themselves, then they are fine by me.

Faile, I didn’t say a deer would come onto my lawn and kill me and eat me. But if it came on my lawn I would kill and eat it. Heck, I would even come on its “lawn” and kill and eat it. But I was talking about other animals eating me. Like mountian lions and so on. Every animal or plant is meant to be eaten by another animal or plant, thus the circle of life. I think vegetarians/vegans are just defying nature, and indirectly breaking the circle of life.

And I used vegans and vegetarians interchangeably because I meant it as a generalization (just people who don’t eat meat, period).

Read full topic
item.source: What do you think about vegetarianism?

item.title: What do you think about vegetarianism?
item.dc:creator: @BlackThursday BlackThursday
item.description:
@BlackThursday wrote:

[quote=“philodespotos, post:10, topic:4384”][quote author=PaulT link=topic=5676.msg57488#msg57488 date=1151981588]
first of all being a vegetarian should
never be associated with being
a revolutionary or being open-minded.
[/quote]
Now now, you know you should be citing your sources. And CannOx -> Kaitnieks wasn’t a bad effort. Anyhow, congrats on having good taste: socialist hiphop always takes the cake. Just don’t pretend to be writing something yourself.

As for vegetarianism: Most generalizations of vegetarians are ludicrous. Some people don’t like meat. Some people don’t agree with killing other creatures. Those who preach it incessantly can be safely ignored, just like those who complain about vegetarians.

However, there is a significant segment of the vegetarian, and especially vegan, population that annoys me to no end: those who openly admit to enjoying the meats and other animal-derived products, but refuse to consume them because of the quality of factory farms. I’m the first to agree about enormous, corporate farms being gross beyond belief. But these people, rather than supporting an organic, family farm alternative, which would actually make a viable difference in the market, instead take an entirely reactionary position that accomplishes nothing but depriving a handful of companies of a single consumer.

These types are typically thoughtless, seem to enjoy the image of veganism more than the meaning, and, unfortunately, refuse to listen logic. Such is life.[/quote]

Like i said man… Hippie Shit.

Read full topic
item.source: What do you think about vegetarianism?

As for vegetarianism: Most generalizations of vegetarians are ludicrous. Some people don’t like meat. Some people don’t agree with killing other creatures. Those who preach it incessantly can be safely ignored, just like those who complain about vegetarians.

However, there is a significant segment of the vegetarian, and especially vegan, population that annoys me to no end: those who openly admit to enjoying the meats and other animal-derived products, but refuse to consume them because of the quality of factory farms. I’m the first to agree about enormous, corporate farms being gross beyond belief. But these people, rather than supporting an organic, family farm alternative, which would actually make a viable difference in the market, instead take an entirely reactionary position that accomplishes nothing but depriving a handful of companies of a single consumer.

item.title: What do you think about vegetarianism?
item.dc:creator: @Faile Faile
item.description:
@Faile wrote:

[quote=“Zach1188, post:1, topic:4384”]I just want to know who is a vegan, why the are/aren’t, etc. But please do not let this turn into a flame war.

Me:
I am NOT a vegetarian. In fact, vegans tend to annoy me severely. Some kid was walking around my school trying to get everyone to become vegans. He is lucky I’m nice, or I would have beaten the living crap out of him. Of course, I bet someone else already did. Heres the five main types of vegans:

Nazi Vegans: These idiots try to change everyones mind and make all meat eaters go vegan. Then they get mad when they wont. I personally HATE these ones, and feel like slamming them against a wall.

Psuedo (fake) vegans: These just annoy me. They are the ones who say “Oh I don’t eat meat, but I eat chicken (or fish).” I have nothing to say to these ones. Some of them even get mad at peope who eat beef, etc.

Standard Vegans: I have no problem with these ones. They are vegans, but keep to themselves, and don’t get mad at meat eaters. If a meat eaters question them about it, they also put up a good debate, which I also respect.

Obsessive vegans: The ones who are afraid to step on bugs, or afraid to look at an animal funny in the fear of “scaring” it. They are fun to make fun of.

Hide in a corner Vegans: The ones who are vegan, leave people alone and let them eat meat, but if someone questions them about it, they don’t put up a good debate or support their oppinion. These ones are usually just trying to be the “hero”.

Summary:
I am fine with vegans, but I can’t stand the ones who are obsessive, bossy, or cannot support their opinion. I think animals are meant to be eaten, period. I know that sounds harsh, but I include humans in that too. If we get lost in the woods or general wilderness, we will get eaten. If I lived in the woods and a dear is on my lawn, I would pull out a gun and next thing you know I have dinner, a very good one at that. If you ask me, thats fair. They can kill us, so I WILL kill them. Of course, I wouldn’t hunt for sport, I would eat what I kill.[/quote]

just outa intrest if you were on the lawn at the same time as the dear are you saying the dear would kill and eat you?

Personaly i dont care what the vegens or vegitarians do its their life and as long as they dont get me to try and convert im fine with them i even tryed being one for a while and anyone who can do it then well done

PaulT

actualy you cant get away with a rant about bad health as its not true anymore… there are lots of soya products that not ownly are very helthy and has a lot of nutriants for a bean but if you dont like that then its possable to be perfectly healthy just eating plants or non meat products its ownly bad for you if your limeted by allergyes like i was

Finaly

Vegitarians and vegens are diffrent things ( i think ) vegitarians normaly just dont eat meat and eat everyghing else ( some eat fish for some reason… are they less of an animal than a whale? ) but vegens genraly dont eat meat, fish and animal food products (eg. milk, eggs)
